background: An electronics store is optimizing inventory for phones and laptops with constraints on floor space, spending cap, and a ratio of laptops to the total appliances.
constraints: Floor space for phones and laptops does not exceed TotalSpace
At least MinLaptopRatio of all appliances in stock must be laptops
The store spends at most MaxSpend on purchasing phones and laptops
objective: Maximize the store's profit from the sale of phones and laptops
description: An electronics store wants to optimize how many phones and laptops are enough to keep in inventory. A phone will earn the store \var{ProfitPhone} in profits, and a laptop will earn \var{ProfitLaptop}. A phone requires \var{SpacePhone} sq ft of floor space, whereas a laptop requires \var{SpaceLaptop} sq ft. In total, \var{TotalSpace} sq ft of floor space is available. The store stocks only phones and laptops. Corporate has required that at least \var{MinLaptopRatio} of all appliances in stock be laptops. Finally, a phone costs \var{CostPhone} for the store, and a laptop, \var{CostLaptop}. The store wants to spend at most \var{MaxSpend}. Formulate an LP that can be used to maximize the store's profit.

parameters.definition: Floor space required by one phone
Floor space required by one laptop
Minimum percentage of total appliances that must be laptops
Cost of one phone for the store
Cost of one laptop for the store
Maximum amount store wants to spend on inventory
